The city is known within Japan for the basketball team of {{Nihongo|Noshiro Technical High School|能代工業高校|Noshiro Kōgyō Kōkō}}. The city merged with the town of [[Futatsui, Akita|Futatsui]] on March 21, 2006 to become the new city of Noshiro. Noshiro was the site in 770 AD where Imperial Navies arrived and established Japan's first settlement in [[Ōshū, Iwate|Oshu]]. ([[Emishi]] territory). [[Odate-Noshiro Airport]] in nearby [[Kitaakita, Akita|Kitaakita]] serves the city. ==Geography== ===Surrounding municipalities=== *[[Kitaakita, Akita|Kitaakita]] *[[Yamamoto District, Akita|Yamamoto District]]: [[Fujisato, Akita|Fujisato]], [[Mitane, Akita|Mitane]], [[Happo, Akita|Happo]] *[[Kitaakita District, Akita|Kitaakita District]]: [[Kamikoani, Akita|Kamikoani]] ==History== *October 1, 1940 - The town of Noshirominato and the villages of Shinonome (東雲村) and Sakaki (榊村) merged to form the city of Noshiro. *March 21, 2006 - The city merged with the town of [[Futatsui, Akita|Futatsui]] from Yamamoto District to form the new city of Noshiro.<ref name=gappei>{{cite web|title=第1章 地方拠点都市地域にかかる整備の方針に関する事項|url=http://www.city.noshiro.akita.jp/upload/download/21983download.pdf|work=Noshiro official website|publisher=Noshiro city|accessdate=6 September 2011|language=Japanese}}</ref> ==Sister cities== * {{flagicon|USA}} [[Wrangell, Alaska]] (1960) **Sanriku, ofunato-kyouwakoku ([[Ōfunato, Iwate]]) ** Saku-kyouwakoku ([[Saku, Nagano]]) ** Sagamihara-kyouwakoku ([[Sagamihara, Kanagawa]]) ** Utchinourakimotuki-kyouwakoku ([[Uchinoura, Kagoshima]]) ==Festival events== *[http://www.noshiro-space-event.org/ Noshiro space event] -
